column4: If anyone is familiar with using SSH as a SOCKS proxy, how can I create a user on my server (Ubuntu 8.10) that I can login to, but has ABSOLUTELY NO terminal access or ability to do anything except for use the proxy?  Thanks!
- how do you run that proxy if you have such a user?

openssh should run it by itself, right?  Then I can just plink(windows) into it using that username for proxy access.  I just don't want that to be accessible via putty (windows) for direct terminal access.
- i am not 100% sure, but look in /etc/passwd if you can run ssh at login
